frame.name: Direction
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Path</fen> made up of a set of positions in some N-space <fen>Domain</fen> (often spatial) is determined as a function of a <fen>Base_position</fen> and some one-dimensional <fen>Independent_variable</fen> (often time). For many of the words of this frame, the <fen>Domain</fen> and/or the <fen>Independent_variable</fen> are incorporated in the basic definition of the target.
<ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Path"><t>East</t></fex> <fex name="Base_position">of Mt. Diablo</fex> the Sierras rise majestically above the Central Valley.</ex> <ex></ex>
In this case, the <fen>Domain</fen> and the <fen>Independent_variable</fen> are both spatial.</def-root>

FE.name: Base_position
FE.definition: <def-root>The point of reference from which the rest of the <fen>Path</fen> is reckoned.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>The kind of space in which the set of points of the <fen>Path</fen> is defined. <ex>Let us progess a bit <t>forward</t> <fex name="Dom">in time</fex> to the Napoleonic wars.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Independent_variable
FE.definition: <def-root>The one-dimensional variable with respect to which the positions on the <fen>Path</fen> are reckoned. For normal motion, the positions on the <fen>Path</fen> are with respect to time.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>How much along the <fen>Path</fen> from the <fen>Base_position</fen> that there has been movement in the stated direction.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: east.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: towards the point of the horizon where the sun rises at the equinoxes, on the right-hand side of a person facing north.

lexUnit.name: up.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: towards a higher place or position.

lexUnit.name: forward.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: in the direction that one is facing or travelling.

lexUnit.name: left.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: on or to the left side.

lexUnit.name: right.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: on or to the right side

lexUnit.name: north.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: the direction in which a compass needle normally points, towards the horizon on the left-hand side of a person facing east.

lexUnit.name: south.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the direction towards the point of the horizon 90 deg clockwise from east.

lexUnit.name: west.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the direction towards the point of the horizon where the sun sets at the equinoxes, on the left-hand side of a person facing north.

lexUnit.name: east.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the direction towards the point of the horizon where the sun rises at the equinoxes, on the right-hand side of a person facing north.

lexUnit.name: south.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: the direction towards the point of the horizon 90 degrees clockwise from east.

lexUnit.name: outward.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: going out or away from a place.
